sentences.english: Interestingly, with the emperor, empress on pepper.
sentences.chinese: 有趣的是，花椒與皇帝后妃有關。

sentences.english: Lychees were the favorite fruit of a famous queen in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 荔枝是中國歷史上一位有名的后妃最愛的水果。

sentences.english: In Jerusalem David took more wives and became the father of more sons and daughters.
sentences.chinese: 大衛在耶路撒冷又立后妃，又生兒女。

sentences.english: And David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David fathered more sons and daughters.
sentences.chinese: 大衛在耶路撒冷又立后妃，又生兒女。

sentences.english: The imperial queens and concubines in the Western Han Dynasty were a group of females with tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 西漢后妃是一個具有悲劇色彩的女性羣體。

sentences.english: She was the Emperor's favorite concubine, but because of this she attracted the jealousy of many people.
sentences.chinese: 寵愛的后妃，但也因此招來了很多人的嫉妒。

sentences.english: After the Qing-dynasty emperor Kangxi, most emperors, empresses and concubines had their seals made of bloodstone.
sentences.chinese: 清代康熙以後歷代皇帝和后妃多用雞血石作寶璽。

sentences.english: Also used after the code name for the empress.
Some queens and concubines became totally the sacrifice of politics.
sentences.chinese: 還有一些后妃則完全成爲政治犧牲品。

sentences.english: The Phoenix Pavilion was the place where emperor and his empress and concubines informal dined and read.
sentences.chinese: 鳳凰樓是滿清皇帝和后妃便宴及讀書之處。

definition: imperial concubine or palace maid/imperial secretary (old)
wives and concubines (of a polygamous man)/harem
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
